elements.name: study_information
elements.html:
During the session, you:
  • Will be wearing an EEG headband
  • May be awakened
  • May have a wake period
  • May perform a cognitive training
  • May receive sensory cues
  • Will fill out several questionnaires

elements.name: written_instruction
elements.html:
1. Position the ZMax headband on a flat portion of your forehead, just above your eyebrows.
  2. The lower central electrode should not protrude. If it does, you may trim a small portion to ensure a proper fit.
  3. Ensure the headband fully covers the lateral sensing areas.
  4. The headband should not be too loose to prevent shifting during sleep.
  5. Tighten the headband at the back of your head, just below the inion bone, at a slight downward angle (not completely parallel to the ground).
  6. No hair should be underneath the lateral sensing areas. If necessary, use smaller electrodes (female/children size) or trim a portion of the lateral sensing areas.
  7. Ensure the metallic snaps are fully inserted. You should hear four distinct clicks when securing them and no clicks when wearing the device.
  8. After wearing the headband, press gently on the device, sensing surfaces, and headband to confirm a snug fit that can withstand nighttime movements.
